intro: Anthemis ageratifolia, commonly known as the common tansy, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features finely divided, fern-like leaves and produces small yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. It is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of environmental conditions. Its botanical features make it a notable species in both ecological and horticultural contexts.
